title: MySQLSTRCMP()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLSTRCMP()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Compare two strings:
SELECT STRCMP("SQL Tutorial", 
  "SQL Tutorial");

Definition and Usage
The STRCMP() function compares two strings.
Syntax
STRCMP(
string1
,
string2
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string1, string2
Required. The two strings to be compared
Return Values
If
string1
=
string2
, this function returns 0
If
string1
<
string2
, this function returns -1
If
string1
>
string2
, this function returns 1
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Compare two strings:
SELECT STRCMP("SQL Tutorial", 
  "HTML Tutorial");

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLSTRCMP()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLSTRCMP()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLSTRCMP()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
